tweet: CHECK IT OUT: Ranking Members @RepJerryNadler & @RepCummings full statement on today’s call with #TrumpAdministration’s Acting AG #Whitaker. http://democrats-oversight.house.gov/news/press-releases/repnadler-and-repcummings-statement-following-call-with-acting-attorney-general …

Over a year ago, we requested a hearing regarding the #TrumpAdministration response to #HurricaneMaria & #HurricaneIrma. Watch a full recap of Ranking Member @RepCummings powerful opening statement from today’s hearing. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A3TzxrfkCwE …

NEWS ALERT: @RepCummings and Rep. @GerryConnolly urge GOP to end partisan, multi-year investigation of the Clinton Foundation and focus on #Trump and #Whitaker Foundations http://democrats-oversight.house.gov/news/press-releases/top-dems-urge-gop-to-end-partisan-multi-year-investigation-of-clinton-foundation …
“I guarantee you, Administrator Long, this hearing will  not be your last before us.  We want full compliance with every one of  our previous requests.  You are on notice.”

.@RepCummings: “When disaster strikes, the American people do not want politics—they want results.  They do not want posturing—they want leadership.  They do not want excuses—they want a nonpartisan, effective, and efficient response that save lives. ”

The email states: 
“Mr. Byrne, we need help.  More than two months following Hurricane Maria, we are watching our local electric crews struggle to repair the system with no equipment and no material.  We are hearing estimates that we will be one year without regular power. WHY?”
"The sender’s name is redacted, but it is from someone on the ground in Vieques in Puerto Rico. "

NEW DOC: email exchange sent on November 29, 2017—70 days after the hurricane struck.  This email was sent to Mike Byrne, the top FEMA official overseeing the response in Puerto Rico.   http://bit.ly/OGR11291
"Today, I am releasing additional documents that also contradict President Trump’s claims about his Administration’s response. ”

“Nearly 3,000 people died in this tragedy—more than in Hurricane Katrina.  But rather than recognizing any failings by his own Administration, President Trump accused Democrats of somehow manufacturing the death count.”
"Puerto Rican officials communicated these concerns directly to FEMA in person and in writing, but by September 27—a full week after the hurricane—no fuel was provided. "
"My staff obtained documents showing Walmart explaining repeatedly that their grocery stores had generators in place, but they needed emergency fuel to keep the food from spoiling. "
"They ignored one of the key lessons from Hurricane Katrina—setting up advance contracts for emergency provisions. "

"Unfortunately, the facts on the ground show the exact opposite.  “The Trump Administration completely botched a massive $156 million contract to deliver 30 million emergency meals in the aftermath of the storm. "

.@RepCummings at today’s hearing on the #TrumpAdmin response to 2017 hurricanes: Last year, after devastating hurricanes slammed into #PuertoRico and the #USVirginIslands, President Trump repeatedly touted his Administration’s response as “unbelievable,” and “amazing”.

“I am deeply concerned by the sudden reversal by former Attorney General Sessions of the Obama Administration’s decision to phase out private prisons. Yet, without any evidence of improved conditions or accountability by the Trump Administration.”

“Women who want help are left to wait months or years for even basic access to trauma related treatment—if they receive it at all—because there is only one staff person assigned to each facility to implement the trauma program.”  @RepMaloney #BureauofPrisons hearing

.@RepMaloney at today’s #BureauofPrisons hearing: “The Obama Administration strengthened policies for managing and treating female inmates in 2016…The new report Mr. Horowitz released, however, documents how the #TrumpAdministration is not fully implementing these new policies.”

“The American people WANT checks and balances. That’s what we are going to DO for them in the next congress.” @repcummings #MTP

"The President has controlled the legislature because they have been aiding and defending him. He controls the executive branch and now he is trying to control judiciary. So he's basically had all three branches with no check. NOW he has a check."@repcummings #MTP

"I want to hold him accountable to the American people and hold him accountable to himself. Keep in mind, he is the one who said that he's for prescription drugs going down. Also, he complained during the election about the infrastructure. NOW is the time. "@RepCummings #MTP
"The American people said to us through this election that we want accountability. We want a check on this president." @RepCummings #MTP

"We are very concerned about the #SaudiArabia issue. It is something that we will definitely look into. We want to know if the president is acting in the best interests of the American people.” @RepCummings #MTP

.@RepCummings on #POTUS tweet about Rep. Schiff: Mr. President this is beneath you and beneath this office. ...We don't have time for name calling because we have too much to do.

.@RepCummings:  I plan to deal with subpoenas in a careful and deliberate way with standards. I will consult with the minority, but we will do it very carefully and not haphazardly. ... The American people have asked for integrity, transparency, and accountability.
.@RepCummings on top priorities: I want to look at the citizenship question that was added to the Census, voter suppression, skyrocketing drug prices.

.@RepCummings: I would hope we would protect this investigation. Sen. McConnell is in a position to have a direct impact by allowing the legislation to go forth which would protect the Special Counsel, but now he says it's not needed. I disagree & I hope he changes his mind.
.@RepCummings on Acting Attorney General Whitaker: I have a lot of concerns not only with the scam, but also concerns of the appearance of the conflicts of interest.
Tune in now to see @RepCummings on @mitchellreports !
.@RepCummings on oversight priorities: I want to look at voting rights, protecting people with preexisting conditions, the Census, and the Postal Sevice.
.@RepCummings Nancy Pelosi has been phenomenal and believes in the inclusion revolution.
.@RepCummings I would do everything in my power to make sure the findings of the (Mueller) probe are presented to the Congress and to the public.

.@RepCummings I’m concerned about the Acting Attorney General. I’m hoping to see him recuse himself because of the things he said about his opinion of the probe. I don’t think he is the proper person to be in that position.
.@RepCummings on @FaceTheNation soon! Tune in!

I look forward to the Committee conducting a systematic and thorough investigation of this issue, and I also anticipate developing long overdue legislation to strengthen standards for these processes and to expand transparency as much as possible while protecting privacy.

The Committee must conduct thorough oversight over how agencies handle allegations of harassment and bullying. The Committee also must ensure that the Forest Service will hold perpetrators fully accountable.
I thank Ms. Reed for her courage in coming forward and for her willingness to testify.  You are opening the door for more women to come forward and say we aren't taking it anymore.
Documents provided in response to the Committee’s requests contain extensive and inappropriate redactions.  They contradict the agency’s claim it is committed to transparency.

The #ForestService has made improvements in the processes it uses to receive and investigate allegations of harassment and bullying.  But it is clear that, two years later, many employees still believe the agency tolerates harassment, bullying, and retaliation.

Given the life-threatening risks that #ForestService employees regularly face in their careers, it is critical that we ensure that the #ForestService is a place where no one feels afraid to come to work because of what a co-worker might do to them.
.@RepCummings speaking soon at oversight hearing on sexual harassment & retaliation at the Forest Service.

@RepCummings on Nancy Pelosi: She is battle-tested. It is her time. I’m looking forward to working with her as my Speaker.
.@RepCummings on working with Republicans: I see subpoenas as a method of last resort. I would like to have consultation with the Rs, but if we can’t agree, then I will do what I think is best.
.@RepCummings on oversight priorities: I want to look at voting rights, the citizenship question the Administration added to the census, Emoluments clause violations, and prescription drug pricing.
.@RepCummings: I’m not going to war. I’m going to do what the American people want us to do. #accountablity and #transparency
